If an interpolation function \\( h(t) \\) is applied as an intervention after \\( x(t) \\) is reconstructed from \\( X(s) \\), will the resultant \\( y(t) = L(h(t) * x(t)) \\) (where * denotes convolution) still depend only on the original operator \\( L \\), and not on the transformations applied?
Explanation: The intervention with the function \\( h(t) \\) modifies the original function \\( x(t) \\) by convolution, creating a new function upon which \\( L \\) acts.
